oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of the Old Hickory Gunpowder Plant
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This photograph shows part of the industrial area at the DuPont Gunpowder plant. Located at a bend in the Cumberland River near Nashville, Tennessee, the plant was 93 % completed by the time of the Armistice of November 11th 1918. The plant was the largest munitions plant in the world at the time of operation, 1918-1919, occupying some 4,700 acres and producing half a million pounds of powder a day. The smokestacks in the picture on the left mark the site of the power house for the plant.
